ISSUE.TITLE: Clearing "Widget type" field produces a ValueError: Unregistered widget class:
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: ### Deployment Type Self-hosted ### NetBox Version v4.2.5 ### Python Version 3.10 ### Steps to Reproduce 1. On the Dashboard, unlock and click "Add Widget" 2. On the popup dialog, click the X to clear the "Widget type" field (or backspace over the preselected value) 3. App crashes with the below observed error ### Expected Behavior App should not crash; form should not trigger any dynamic parsing that tries to validate an empty input value ### Observed Behavior ``` ValueError at /extras/dashboard/widgets/add/ Unregistered widget class: Request URL: http://127.0.0.1:8000/extras/dashboard/widgets/add/?widget_class= ```

BUGGYCOMMIT.MESSAGE: Merge pull request #18854 from netbox-community/18782-dashboard-broken-on-notification-list-widget Fixes #18782: Misconfigured `ObjectListWidget`s now degrade gracefully

COMMIT.MESSAGE: Fixes #18944: Clearing widget type field no longer causes 500 error
